creator: cs@koch-aplsystems.de
text:
This happened since I upgraded to 2.2.13

Strange thing is, the error page displays instantly when using a SLL connection to the same directory. The problem only occurs with HTTP connections.

Error log shows:
"Directory index forbidden by Options directive: ..."
as expected

Access log shows:
"/test/ HTTP/1.1" 403 334" for HTTP that seems to time out
and
"/test/ HTTP/1.1" 403 336" for HTTPS where everything seems to work fine

If you have any questions I'm willing to test more.

Disabling mod_ssl does not change the situation.

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Providing your configuration would be a good starting point.
You mentioned an upgrade. What was the version you used before?

creator: cs@koch-aplsystems.de
text:
The old version was 2.2.3 without SSL
The new server signature "Apache/2.2.13 (Win32) mod_ssl/2.2.13 OpenSSL/0.9.8k PHP/5.2.11"

As it is a production server I cannot copy paste all .conf files...

Is there any setting in particular you are interested in?
An obfuscated version of the conf does it (replace IPs with XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX, ports with YYYY, servernames with example1.com, directories with dummy locations, etc.).
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
I have just installed a fresh httpd on another machine and with the default configuration this does not seem to happen...
Darn.

I have reduced my config to include only the essentials. See attachment.
Maybe I'm just to blind to find it...
SSL does not seem to influence this behavior but I included it anyways.

Strange thing is: When I access the server via its IP address then the error message is instant.
creator: cs@koch-aplsystems.de
cs@koch-aplsystems.de
text:
Created attachment 24307
my edited configuration files

creator: cs@koch-aplsystems.de
text:
Forget it all...
I'm stupid :)

Our corporate firewall blocked all 403 responses as someone was messing with the IPS settings. Apache is innocent.

That's why https was working all the time.
